quote: Have faith in your beliefs
author: Michael Christos Zeis

quote: Belief is the wound that knowledge heals.
author: Ursula K. Le Guin,  The Telling

quote: Belief means not wanting to know what is true.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Belief consists in accepting the affirmations of the soul; unbelief, in denying them.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Belief creates the actual fact.
author: William James

quote: Beliefs that are good promote your potential and enhance your unique special qualities.
author: Deborah Day

quote: Beliefs are not related to religion but they are basically about who you are.
author: Stephen Richards,  Think Your way to Success: Let Your Dreams Run Free

quote: belief is the death of intelligence.
author: Robert Anton Wilson,  Cosmic Trigger: Die letzten Geheimnisse der Illuminaten oder An den Grenzen des erweiterten Bewusstseins

quote: Our belief is not a belief. Our principles are not a faith. We do not rely soley upon science and reason, because these are necessary rather than sufficient factors, but we distrust anything that contradicts science or outrages reason. We may differ on many things, but what we respect is free inquiry, openmindedness, and the pursuit of ideas for their own sake.
author: Christopher Hitchens,  God Is Not Great: How Religion Poisons Everything

quote: Faith ― acceptance of which we imagine to be true, that which we cannot prove.
author: Dan Brown,  The Da Vinci Code

quote: Religion. A daughter of Hope and Fear, explaining to Ignorance the nature of the Unknowable.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Belief isn't supposed to make sense, at least not all the time. In that, it finds its power. It gets to creep up on you and carry you forward. Until you can carry yourself again.
author: Laura Dave,  The Divorce Party

quote: The people and successes in your life mirror your beliefs.
author: Steve Backley,  The Champion in all of Us: 12 Rules for Success

quote: What we believe is heavily influenced by what we think others believe
author: Thomas Gilovich,  How We Know What Isn't So: The Fallibility of Human Reason in Everyday Life

quote: Trust in your own beliefs or succumb to the influence of others’.
author: Steve Backley,  The Champion in all of Us: 12 Rules for Success

quote: Belief can be manipulated. Only knowledge is dangerous.
author: Frank Herbert

quote: Religion, n. A daughter of Hope and Fear, explaining to Ignorance the nature of the Unknowable.
author: Ambrose Bierce,  The Unabridged Devil's Dictionary

quote: If faith is what you have to go on, if faith is the link between your beliefs and the world at large, your beliefs are very likely to be wrong. Beliefs can be right or wrong. If you believe you can fly, that belief is only true if indeed you can fly. Somebody who thinks he can fly, and is wrong about it, will eventually discover there's a problem with his view of the world.
author: Sam Harris

quote: What we do comes out of who we believe we are.
author: Rob Bell,  Sex God: Exploring the Endless Connections Between Sexuality and Spirituality

quote: A faith to live by, a self to live with, and a purpose to live for.
author: Bob Harrington

quote: Believe what you believe and it will be, believe what others believe and they will consume you!
author: Stanley Victor Paskavich

quote: Belief doesn't rest on proof or existence...it rests on faith...without faith there is nothing.
author: Colleen McCullough,  The Thorn Birds

quote: Science adjusts its views based on what's observedFaith is the denial of observation so that belief can be preserved.
author: Tim Minchin

quote: Believe in the wonderment of life, the magic of love, and the reality of death.
author: Carroll Bryant

quote: Believe only half of what you see and nothing that you hear.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: Your beliefs have the power to unlock your inner genius or keep you from fully achieving your greatest potential.
author: Deborah Day,  BE HAPPY NOW!

quote: knowledge, absolutely sure of its infallibility, is faith
author: Yevgeny Zamyatin,  We

quote: Some things have to be believed to be seen
author: Ralph Hodgson

quote: Faith, n. Belief without evidence in what is told by one who speaks without knowledge, of things without parallel.
author: Ambrose Bierce,  The Unabridged Devil's Dictionary

quote: What each of us believes in is up to us, but life is impossible without believing in something.
author: Kentetsu Takamori,  Unlocking Tannisho: Shinran's Words on the Pure Land Path

quote: Some things have to be believed to be seen.
author: Madeleine L'Engle

quote: Every concept of reality is all in our head, belief is what makes truth.
author: Christy Leigh Stewart

quote: I am a religious person, although I am not a believer.
author: Philip Pullman

quote: One of my defining beliefs is that Jesus Christ has taken all of my guilt before God, and that he has been raised from the dead. That gives incredible hope and meaning to every day of my life - that nothing done in this world is wasted when it's done for him and his glory, and that there will be a day of justice and reward for the entire world.
author: Joshua Harris

quote: You don’t believe things because they make your life better, you believe them because they’re true.
author: Veronica Roth,  Allegiant

quote: I believe in study. I believe that men learn much through study. As a matter of fact, it has been my observationthat they learn little concerning things as they are, as they were, or as they are to come without study. I alsobelieve, however, and know, that learning by study is greatly accelerated by faith.
author: Marion G. Romney

quote: Believe in people, they fly for a day. Teach them to believe in themselves, they soar for a lifetime.
author: A.D. Posey

quote: But what really matters is not what you believe but the faith and conviction with which you believe…
author: Knut Hamsun,  Mysteries

quote: Your beliefs don't make you a better person, your behavior does.
author: Sukhraj S. Dhillon

quote: To believe in God or in a guiding force because someone tells you to is the height of stupidity. We are given senses to receive our information within. With our own eyes we see, and with our own skin we feel. With our intelligence, it is intended that we understand. But each person must puzzle it out for himself or herself.
author: Sophy Burnham

quote: To force oneself to believe and to accept a thing without understanding is political, and not spiritual or intellectual.
author: Gautama Buddha

quote: I believe in the hands that work, in the brains that think, and in the hearts that love...I believe in sunshine, fresh air, friendship, calm sleep, beautiful thoughts.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: We all reach a point that is the limit of our understanding. When we stare over the precipice of uncertainty and into the dark unknown that we cannot explain with hard evidence, that is when we trade understanding for belief. At best, we make an educated guess. At worst, we make blind leaps of faith.
author: Ramsey Isler,  The Ninth Order

quote: We are willing to believe anything other than the truth.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón

quote: When you act on your beliefs, the realisation that happens is caused by you and this will in turn lead to a consequence.
author: Stephen Richards,  Think Your way to Success: Let Your Dreams Run Free

quote: Every worldview has to bring together reason and faith.
author: Ravi Zacharias

quote: Understanding is a three edged sword: your side, their side, and the truth.
author: J. Michael Straczynski

quote: Have faith have faith. When you have nothing else have faith.
author: Francine Rivers,  A Voice in the Wind

quote: Trust comes from courage; beliefs are derived from fear.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Faith in faith' he answered himself. 'It isn't necessary to have something to believe in. It's only necessary to believe that somewhere there's something worthy of belief.
author: Alfred Bester,  The Stars My Destination
